title: 'I trusted her with my life': Carer who 'robbed her dying and disabled clients' is finally nabbed
text:
A Western Sydney carer has pleaded guilty to stealing more than $40,000 worth of jewellery and cash from her terminally ill and disabled patients.

Violeta Hansen allegedly stole goods including watches, necklaces, rings and cash from patients in Bexley, Doonside, Wiley Park and Drummoyne over a 10-month period.

Her patients have been left devastated by her thieving actions, with patients and their families saying they treated her like family.

Patient Nadine Jebraiel (pictured) had some of her possessions allegedly stolen by Violeta Hansen

'I trusted her with my life,' patient Nadine Jebraiel told 9News. 'I can't do a thing.'

The 46-year-old was arrested at a pawn shop in Blacktown Westfield after police left her details with shop staff and asked them to contact her if she was seen at the store.

She was known to exchange her loot for money in various pawn shops in Blacktown, with staff managing to stall her and keep her on site before police arrived.

Hansen pleaded guilty to multiple charges of stealing property in dwelling/house and making a statement which is false/misleading.

'It is a significant betrayal of trust by a person employed to care for the most vulnerable members of our community,' Detective Supt Paul Devaney said.

Hansen will be sentenced next month.
description: A Western Sydney carer has pleaded guilty to stealing more than $40,000 worth of jewellery and cash from her terminally ill and disabled patients.
authors: Jackson Barron For Daily Mail Australia
